intro: Tradescantia virginiana f. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflower spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often variegated with shades of green and white, adding ornamental value to gardens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
